title: T.N. Archaeology Department begins survey for excavation in Nagapattinam

title: Kerala Police suspends Peroorkada SI for wrongful detention of Dalit woman, sparking political controversy

title: ‘Damning indictment of government’: Congress on Supreme Court barring granting of retrospective environmental clearances

title: Five killed, two injured as car falls onto dry riverbed in Maharashtra’s Ratnagiri district
content: The accident occurred near Khed around 5:45 a.m., when the vehicle first hit the divider and fell into the dry river bed of the Jagbudi River

title: FIR against more than 100 people for unauthorised protests in Maharashtra’s Thane district
content: More than 100 people were booked in Thane district, Maharashtra, for participating in unauthorised human chain protests against a journalist’s externment order

title: Port curbs on imports from Bangladesh to have impact in Bengal, but national interest supreme: Officials
content: A trade expert said the finished garments from Bangladesh often make their way into modern Indian retail chains at low prices, and these products are effectively being "dumped into the market by Bangladeshi exporters".

title: Trinamool to opt out of all-party delegation to convey India’s united message
content: “Centre or Union government cannot decide unilaterally who will go from which party.. Centre should show good intent and call for a wider deliberations from all parties in the Opposition,”  Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee said

title: Kerala Plus Two Class 12 results to be declared on May 22
content: A total of 4.44 lakh students registered for the examination. Valuation of Plus Two higher secondary answer scripts has been completed

content: Chief Justice B.R. Gavai agreed to list the plea for hearing after Mathews Nedumpara, who is the petitioner-in-person, sought an urgent hearing in a day or two

title: Supreme Court to hear case against Ashoka University professor’s arrest over social media posts on Operation Sindoor
content: Mr. Khan was remanded to two days’ police custody in one of the two cases. In the second case, filed by Mr. Jathedi, he was remanded to judicial custody

title: Uttar Pradesh ATS arrests Shahzad for suspected ISI-linked espionage acts
content: Special Task Force arrests Shahzad for alleged cross-border smuggling and espionage activities for ISI

content: IMD has issued yellow alert in Bengaluru till May 23, orange alert in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi, Uttara Kannada, Haveri, Belagavi

title: Massive fire hits shopping complex in Kerala’s Kozhikode
content: The situation was brought under control after a five-hour long effort by 15 fire tenders from various fire stations

content: The local Met office has issued an orange warning for light to moderate rains accompanied by lightning, hail and gusty winds with a speed of 40-50 kilometres per hour at isolated places

title: What is a Presidential reference? | Explained
content: What does Article 143 of the Constitution state? Do other nations also have provisions wherein the government can raise legal questions with their respective judiciaries? What has President Droupadi Murmu raised with the Supreme Court? Should the top court answer these questions compulsorily?

title: Thunderstorm alert in 17 Telangana districts on May 19
content: The affected districts include Mancherial, Jagtial, Rajanna Sircilla, Karimnagar, Peddapalli, Rangareddy, Hyderabad, Medchal Malkajgiri, Vikarabad, Sangareddy

title: Liquor prices hike likely from today in Telangana, to be round 10% to 15%
content: The increase in prices is expected to bring in additional revenue to the tune of ₹150 crore per month

title: City hospital signs MoU with Teleflex to create a UroLift Center of Education for South Asia
content: The UroLiftTM System uses a minimally invasive approach to treating Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH)

title: Vigilance set to expand probe into ‘trap case’ involving ED official
content: The agency is poised to summon for questioning the ED official allegedly involved in the ‘bribe-for-legal reprieve’ plan. Official sources say the criminal operation seems entrenched and not a one-off offence.

title: Modi govt. continues to ignore V-P's pleas on behalf of farmers: Ramesh's dig on Dhankhar's birthday
content: Earlier this month, the Congress leader had cited Vice-President’s remark that inflation should be considered while providing aid to farmers to take a swipe at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, asking why he had not done so.

title: PM Modi Wishes Joe Biden Speedy Recovery After Prostate Cancer Diagnosis
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday wished a quick and full recovery to former US President Joe Biden, who has been diagnosed with prostate cancer.

title: Joe Biden's Prostate Cancer Has A Gleason Score Of 9: What It Means
content: Prostate cancer is a disease that develops in the prostate gland, a small, walnut-shaped organ located below the bladder and in front of the rectum in men.

title: Who Is Ashoka University Professor Arrested For A Post On Op Sindoor
content: Ali Khan Mahmudabad is the Head of the Department and an assistant professor of History at Ashoka University in Sonipat, Haryana.

title: Donald Trump To Speak With Russia's Putin Today To End "Bloodbath" In Ukraine
content: Trump has repeatedly stressed that he wants to see an end to the conflict, and has recently backed calls for an unconditional 30-day ceasefire.

title: Polar Bear Biopsies Reveal Impact On Arctic Pollution And Climate Change
content: With one foot braced on the helicopter's landing skid, a veterinarian lifted his air rifle, took aim and fired a tranquiliser dart at a polar bear.

title: Bangladeshi Actor, Who Played Sheikh Hasina, Sent To Jail In Murder Case
content: Nusrat Faria was arrested on Sunday at Dhaka's Shahjahanlal International Airport in an alleged attempted murder case.

title: "Face Consequences": Top Court Raps Minister For Colonel Qureshi Remark
content: The Supreme Court has rejected Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shahs apology over his controversial remarks directed at a woman officer of the armed forces in the wake of Op Sindoor anti-terror operations.

title: Vodafone, Airtel, Tata's Plea Over Waiver Of Dues Rejected By Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed the pleas of telecom majors Vodafone, Airtel and Tata Teleservices seeking the waiver of adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues.

title: AI Is Moving Fast. Needs Smarter Regulation Like Climate Policy To Keep Check
content: Artificial intelligence (AI) might not have been created to enable new forms of sexual violence such as deepfake pornography. But that has been an unfortunate byproduct of the rapidly advancing technology.

title: AAP's Raghav Chadha Invited As Keynote Speaker At Asian Leadership Conference
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Raghav Chadha has been invited to serve as a keynote speaker at the Asian Leadership Conference (ALC) 2025, scheduled to be held for two days, on May 21 and 22, in Seoul, South Korea.

title: IPS Officer Arti Singh To Head Mumbai Police's New Intelligence Wing
content: The Joint Commissioner of Police (Intelligence) will report to the Commissioner of Police and will be responsible for overseeing intelligence gathering, including keeping track of sleeper cells.

title: "Silence Is Damning": Rahul Gandhi Targets S Jaishankar Again, BJP Replies
content: Doubling down on his attack on External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar, senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi today reiterated his earlier claim that the Centre informed Pakistan "at the start" of Operation Sindoor

title: Iran To Keep Enriching Uranian "With Or Without Deal", Says Foreign Minister
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Sunday his country would keep enriching uranium "with or without a deal" with world powers, despite ongoing negotiations over its nuclear programme.

title: "Damage Control": Congress' Jairam Ramesh On All-Party Delegations
content: Congress General Secretary in charge of Communications, Jairam Ramesh, on Monday criticised the Central government, describing the decision to send a delegation to key partner countries as a 'damage control' effort.

title: Shrikant Eknath Shinde-Led Delegation To Leave On May 21 With Anti-Terror Message
content: Biju Janata Dal (BJD) Rajya Sabha MP Sasmit Patra on Monday said that the delegation led by Shiv Sena MP Shrikant Eknath Shinde will leave on May 21 and will expose Pakistan's sponsored terrorism across the world.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Tharoor's Nomination For Global Role Has Stirred The Congress Nest
content: Operation Sindoor and its aftermath have stirred the hornet's nest for the Congress. No one has openly spoken out against the leadership, but the actions of some individual leaders and their off-the-record chats reflect a disquiet within.

title: On Pak Protest In Portugal, India's "Operation Sindoor Not Over Yet" Response
content: The Indian Embassy in Portugal issued a response following a protest organised by Pakistani nationals outside the Chancery building near the Embassy office in Lisbon.

title: Rented Bali Villa Cheaper Than 1BHK Flat In Mumbai? A Wild Comparison
content: Travel vlogger and actress Shenaz Treasury has shared a video tour of a beautiful villa in Bali and compared it to her tiny apartment in Mumbai.

title: Trinamool Says Centre Can't Decide MPs For Global Outreach, BJP Responds
content: The Centre had named Trinamool Congress MP Yusuf Pathan to be part of the seven delegations that will travel to different countries to convey India's message of zero-tolerance against terrorism.

title: All High Court Judges Entitled To Full Pension: Supreme Court
content: In a significant verdict, the Supreme Court on Monday held all high court judges, including additional judges, will be entitled to full pension and retirement benefits.

title: Crackdown on fake doctors in Nalgonda; TGMC files FIRs against 14 clinics
content: The accused, many of whom were previously employed as compounders, were allegedly providing unauthorised medical treatments, including administering antibiotics, steroids, and painkiller injections

title: Falcon scam: Telangana CID nabs two family members of absconding accused in Bihar
content: The CID recovered incriminating evidence including ₹8 lakh in cash, high-value fixed deposits, gold jewellery, mobile phones, electronic devices, passports, bank cards and property documents

title: Heritage, hospitality and a heartfelt message: Miss World contestants get a taste of Telangana
content: Inside the TGICCC, contestants were introduced to the technological marvels that support the city’s emergency response systems

title: Two Telugu veterans on 34-foot sailboat chart course from Kiwi coast to Visakhapatnam
content: Their sailboat is currently registered in Poland but is expected to switch to Indian registration upon arrival in Visakhapatnam later this year

title: Kerala Police initiates inquiry into alleged custodial harassment of Dalit woman at Peroorkada police station
content: While the woman was booked under Section 306 (theft by a clerk or servant) of the BNS, it is now deemed that the accusation was false

title: Diplomatic outreach revives memories of ‘dream teams’ that got India out of tight corners
content: The regional and domestic situation quickly morphed into a diplomatic challenge for India when the West powers and human rights watchdogs turned rights into a major tool of diplomacy

title: Invest in Telangana: Dy CM Bhatti to Russian Consul General Valeri Khodzaev
content: The Deputy CM emphasised the presence of excellent professional and engineering colleges that are shaping outstanding human resources in the State

content: Telugu people are a symbol of economic creativity and will be at the forefront when India emerges as the world’s leading economy by 2047, says CM

title: Masula Beach Festival to be celebrated at Manginapudi Beach from June 6 to 8
content: The beach is being decked up for the festival, and cultural programmes, book stalls, beach kabaddi and other competitions will be arranged, says Excise Minister Kollu Ravindra

title: Over 42 unexploded shells from recent cross-border artillery firing destroyed in J&K’s Poonch
content: Indian Army safely neutralises 42 unexploded ordnances in border areas, ensuring civilian safety and normalcy in conflict zones

title: Uphill task ahead for government gearing up to implement free bus travel scheme for women
content: APSRTC may have to allocate 7,930 buses from its fleet for the free bus travel, induct 2,045 additional buses and recruit 11,479 additional staff, including 5,016 drivers, 5016 conductors and 1,447 maintenance staff

title: 70 applications received for scheme to produce electronic components
content: Sources have said earlier that Tata Electronics, Dixon Technologies, and Foxconn were among the big players that have shown interest.

title: Thoothukudi’s furniture park remains largely unoccupied three years after its launch
content: Raising concern over the slow development of the park, investors cite problems with electricity and water facilities and inadequate promotional activity from the State government as the reasons

title: Adani partners with Sparton to develop anti-submarine warfare solutions
content: The partnership aims to localise the production and assembly of complex electronic sensors, navigation systems, and ASW solutions in India under the ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ and ‘Make in India’ initiatives, reducing India’s dependence on imports and foreign OEMs for critical naval technologies

title: West Bengal police issue summons to protesting teachers for damaging government property
content: The police resorted to baton charge to clear the teachers who were protesting the cancellation of appointments of about 26,000 teachers outside Bikash Bhawan on May 15

title: Kannagi-Murugesan ‘honour’ killing: a crime that revealed the ugly reality of caste
content: Murugesan and Kannagi, of Pudukkoorapettai near Virudhachalam, were poisoned to death. The reason: Kannagi, of the Vanniyar community, married Murugesan, a Dalit of the same village

title: The tussle for temple turf
content: West Bengal’s newly built Jagannath Dham, constructed at a cost of ₹250 crore in the coastal town of Digha as a replica of the 12th-century Jagannath Temple in Puri, Odisha, has triggered a row between the two States, finds Shiv Sahay Singh. The temple has cultural and religious significance for those in India’s east, but is also being politically pushed as a counter to what is perceived as the BJP’s ‘north Indian’ Lord Ram

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire accident: CM Revanth Reddy orders probe into fire accident, commends fire personnel
content: The Chief Minister also commended the Fire Services authorities for their prompt response averting heavy loss of lives in the fire incident

title: Jaishankar to visit Netherlands, Denmark and Germany
content: S. Jaishankar will meet the leadership of the three countries and hold discussions with his counterparts on the entire gamut of bilateral relations, regional and global matters of mutual interest

title: Culture unites, politics divides: T.N. Governor
content: Mr. Ravi criticised the influence of Western political ideologies post-Independence, claiming they had led to divisions among people based on religion, language, caste, culture, and food

title: Saroj Ghose, father of India’s science museum movement, passes away
content: The founding Director General of the National Council of Science Museums served in that capacity from 1979 to 1997

title: Two ‘radicalised youth’ arrested by Andhra Pradesh’s Vizianagaram police
content: The accused, natives of Hyderabad and Vizianagaram, were making bombs and involved in anti-national activities, police officials said

title: Gulzar Houz fire accident: Pearl traders’ legacy burnt to ashes, 17 from three generations killed
content: On Saturday evening, the entire family had attended a function with Pankaj’s elder brother Govind, who now lives in Attapur. He had urged them to stay the night. But they returned home around 11 p.m.

title: Kerala rains: Orange alert in northern districts for two days
content: The IMD reiterated that a low pressure area is likely to form in the Arabian Sea off the Karnataka coast around May 22 under the influence of an upper-air cyclonic circulation

title: Supreme Court directs States, Union Territories to reclaim reserved forests allotted to private parties
content: Court declares as illegal the allotment of 11.89 hectares of reserve forest land in Pune for agricultural purposes in 1998 and its sale to a builder the very next year

title: Catholic Congress reasserts relevance of Church leadership
content: Catholic Congress’ international conference takes place in Palakkad. Christians in Kerala will present a united front on key issues, says Thalassery Archbishop Mar Joseph Pamplany

title: Special Supervisory Officer appointed for Animal Welfare in Eluru district
content: The Special Supervisory Officer has been appointed as per the orders of the A.P. High Court and the guidelines of the Animal Welfare Board, to prevent the illegal transportation and slaughter of animals

content: Minister Uttam Reddy examines Bette Thand, Janpahad LI schemes in Suryapet district taken up with ₹304 crore

title: BRS flays govt. for its over-dependency on revenue from liquor sales
content: Party leader Harish Rao says Congress had promised to control liquor flow, but now it’s planning to allow 100 micro breweries

title: Gogoi dismisses Assam CM’s allegations as lies and slander
content: Gaurav Gogoi trashes Himanta Biswa Sarma’s accusation that he visited Pakistan at the invitation of the Inter-Services Intelligence

title: AIMPLB to resume its demonstrations against the Waqf Act
content: The Board had temporarily suspended its protests in solidarity with the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Listen to your conscience, Congress tells its leaders picked by government for all-party delegations
content: The Congress has accused the BJP-led government of playing ‘cheap political games’ by picking just one of the four names nominated by the party for the delegations, but including four other Congress leaders whom the party did not nominate

title: Six ministers review arrangements for TDP’s maiden Mahanadu in Kadapa
content: Party had won a majority of seats in the undivided Kadapa during the general elections last year, thus gaining strength in the district, which had been a bastion of the YSR family for four decades

title: Kozhikode fire: Building rule violations suspected
content: District Collector Snehil Kumar Singh said a detailed investigation would be conducted with the support of experts to clarify the concerns

title: Kurnool and Anantapur district administrations sound alerts as Met department predicts heavy rain
content: Kurnool District Collector P. Ranjth Basha on Sunday directed the officials to maintain vigil to avoid any loss of property or lives and to monitor the situation continuously

title: OKC conquers nerves to roll Nuggets, reach WCF
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder rolled into the Western Conference finals after beating the Nuggets 125-93 in Game 7 on Sunday.

title: Scheffler: Used new driver at PGA after failed test
content: Rory McIlroy's driver wasn't the only one the USGA deemed nonconforming in testing ahead of this week's PGA Championship. Scottie Scheffler confirmed Sunday after his five-stroke victory that he also was forced to use a new driver for the tournament.

title: Nuggets effusive in praise for interim Adelman
content: Nuggets interim coach David Adelman earned praise across the board for his performance during these playoffs and is considered a strong candidate to take over on a permanent basis.

title: Rahm after PGA collapse: 'Tough pill to swallow'
content: After being tied for the PGA Championship lead with nine holes to play, Jon Rahm came up seven shots short of winner Scottie Scheffler on Sunday.

title: Messi urges Miami to be 'united' in 'difficult' time
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi urged the team to stay strong and remain united after losing 3-0 to in-state rival Orlando City SC at Chase Stadium on Sunday night.

title: Liberty eliminates No. 1 Aggies to win regional
content: Liberty beat No. 1 Texas A&M 6-5 on Sunday night to win the Bryan-College Station Regional and eliminate the top-seeded Aggies.

title: WNBA probes 'hateful' comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA is looking into allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed at Angel Reese after an incident involving Caitlin Clark and Reese in Saturday's Sky-Fever game.

title: Marchand continues Game 7 mastery over Leafs
content: In his first season with Florida, forward Brad Marchand became the first player in NHL history to defeat the same opponent in at least five winner-take-all games, as his Panthers crushed the Toronto Maple Leafs 6-1 in Game 7 of the second round on Sunday.

title: Scheffler's PGA Championship win leaves the rest of the golf world playing catch-up
content: Jon Rahm made it close for a while, but Scottie Scheffler's inevitability hung in the Charlotte air all day.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Christopher Bell beats Joey Logano to win NASCAR All-Star Race
content: Christopher Bell passed Joey Logano with nine laps remaining and cruised to victory in an action-packed NASCAR All-Star Race at North Wilkesboro Speedway on Sunday night.

title: Indy 500 rookie Shwartzman wins pole in shocker
content: Robert Shwartzman, who has dual nationality in Israel and Russia, became the first Indy 500 rookie to qualify on the pole since Teo Fabi in 1983.

title: Brilliant Bompastor guides Chelsea to FA Cup glory vs. Man United
content: Chelsea beat Manchester United 3-0 at Wembley Stadium to complete a clean sweep of the women's domestic honors.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Chawinga's brilliance keeps Current No. 1
content: If you make a single mistake against Temwa Chawinga and the Current, you're likely to get punished. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: European soccer review: Premier League's UCL race sets up final-day fireworks
content: With one matchday left, the Premier League's European race is wide open. That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Trophyless again, Arsenal need a lift despite win over Newcastle
content: Arsenal's win over Newcastle all but confirms second place, but another trophyless season is taking its toll.

title: Angel City's King: Medical team 'saved my life'
content: Angel City defender Savy King was released from the hospital Saturday, just more than a week after she collapsed on the field during a match.

title: Arteta challenges board to back him with signings
content: Mikel Arteta has challenged the Arsenal hierarchy to "do what they have to do" in the summer transfer market to turn the club into Premier League champions.

title: Conte sees red as Napoli cling to first in Serie A
content: Napoli's hopes of securing the Serie A title on Sunday had to be put on ice after they were held to a 0-0 draw at Parma.

title: Galaxy still winless after Trafico draw with LAFC
content: Marco Reus scored twice, including the game-tying free kick in the 87th minute as the LA Galaxy earned a 2-2 tie with rival LAFC on Sunday night in Carson, California.

title: Ajax boss emotional after historic title collapse
content: Ajax manager Francesco Farioli has said he has no regrets despite his side finishing as runners-up in the Eredivisie in one of the biggest title collapses in history.

title: Flick 'fine' as Barça lose 1st in LaLiga since Dec.
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick was happy to write off his team's first league defeat since December as the newly crowned LaLiga champions lost 3-2 at home to Villarreal on Sunday.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo Jr. nets 1st Portugal U15s goals
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, scored his first two goals for Portugal's U15 side in Sunday's 3-2 victory against Croatia.

title: Was Imola a one-off or is Verstappen now a title contender?
content: Red Bull have taken a step forward, which means Max Verstappen's win might be a sign of things to come.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Brazil clubs eye Ronaldo for Club World Cup
content: Will Cristiano Ronaldo be suiting up at the Club World Cup in June? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Nation in shame': SC raps MP minister for remarks on Col Qureshi, orders SIT probe
content: The Supreme Court rebuked Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah for his derogatory remarks against an Army officer, deeming his apology insufficient and a national embarrassment.

title: 'His mistake is his name': Cong slams 'BJP manufactured rage' on prof's arrest
content: The Congress party has accused the Modi government of double standards following the arrest of Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad for a social media post critical of violence. Congress leaders highlight the stringent charges against Mahmudabad, contrasting it with the lack of action against BJP ministers accused of demeaning the armed forces.

title: Rahul questions Jaishankar's silence, asks how many aircraft did India lose?
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of external affairs minister S Jaishankar regarding Operation Sindoor, questioning the loss of Indian aircraft due to alleged prior warnings to Pakistan.

title: Bengaluru faces pre-monsoon havoc: Roads flooded, traffic gridlock; 1 dead
content: Bengaluru is facing chaos due to heavy pre-monsoon rains. Waterlogged roads and traffic jams are paralyzing the city. The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike is working to clear the roads. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for Bengaluru. Many areas are experiencing severe waterlogging. Traffic police are issuing warnings about slow-moving traffic. The situation remains dire for residents.

title: Op Sindoor: Did TMC opt out of Centre's all-party delegation? What Mamata said
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) affirms its support to the Centre in combating terrorism, clarifying that while it backs national interest initiatives, the party will decide its delegation members. TMC denies boycotting 'Operation Sindoor,' emphasizing its non-politicization of the issue.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Start date, country, and format – All you need to know
content: Cricket fans eagerly await the Asia Cup 2025, scheduled for September in T20 format. Five full Asian Cricket Council members, including defending champion India, automatically qualified. They'll be joined by Hong Kong, Oman, and the UAE. India, fresh off their Asia Cup victory against Sri Lanka, also secured the Champions Trophy, defeating Pakistan and New Zealand.

title: 'Too tired': Bengal climber was abandoned in Everest ‘death zone’
content: Sherpa Palchen Tamang, accompanying Subrata Ghosh, recounted the harrowing Everest summit. Ghosh, weakened and disoriented near Hillary Step, refused to move despite Tamang's efforts. Exhausted and with dwindling oxygen, Tamang spent hours trying to move Ghosh, but was ultimately forced to descend alone, suffering hallucinations and frostbite during his own difficult return to camp.

title: ‘Spiked’ drink lands UP groom in lock-up as bride calls off union
content: In Sambhal, Kumari Shashi called off her wedding with Amit Rana. She accused him of being drunk. Amit claimed his friends spiked his drink. The bride's family alleged the entire wedding party was intoxicated. Police detained Amit and a relative. Mediation failed, and the marriage was canceled. Gifts were returned, and no formal complaint was filed with the police.

title: US Embassy in India issues warning of permanent ban on traveling: If you...
content: The U.S. Embassy in India has issued a warning about the consequences of overstaying visas. Indian citizens traveling to the U.S. on work, student, or tourist visas risk deportation and a permanent ban if they remain beyond their authorized stay.

title: Uttarakhand PWD officer orders staff to offer rice at temple over missing service book
content: In Lohaghat, Champawat, a PWD officer faced repercussions after invoking a village ritual in an official order. Following the disappearance of Assistant Engineer Jai Prakash's service book, Executive Engineer Ashutosh Kumar instructed staff to offer rice at a temple, seeking divine justice. This action led to his immediate transfer to Pauri.

title: SC rejects pleas by telecom majors for AGR dues waiver, calls appeals 'misconceived'
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed petitions from Vodafone, Airtel, and Tata Teleservices seeking waivers on adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues. Justices Pardiwala and Mahadevan deemed the pleas "misconceived".

title: Sunil Gavaskar takes a jibe at Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir
content: Sunil Gavaskar criticized Gautam Gambhir for overshadowing Shreyas Iyer's captaincy during KKR's IPL 2024 victory, asserting that Iyer didn't receive due recognition. Gavaskar highlighted Iyer's significant role on the field, contrasting it with Gambhir's dugout presence. Currently captaining PBKS, Iyer is finally getting the credit he deserves, especially with Ricky Ponting as head coach.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai once again 'replies to' Satya Nadella's 'dance invite'
content: Sundar Pichai subtly responded to Satya Nadella's remarks about making Google "dance" in the AI race, highlighting the intense competition and innovation driven by prominent tech leaders. Pichai humorously noted that only one of them has invited him to a dance. He emphasized Google's focus on its own path and relentless innovation, rather than following competitors' leads.

title: Karnataka liquor shops to shut on May 21 over licence fee hike
content: Karnataka's liquor industry faces disruption. Distilleries and liquor shops plan a strike on May 20, followed by a shutdown on May 21. This action protests increased excise duties and license fees. Store owners will halt liquor purchases from government depots. Associations cite unbearable fee hikes, impacting businesses and consumers. The government aims to address revenue shortfalls with these increases.

title: Operation Sindoor: 'China gave Pakistan air defence, satellite support'
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist installations prompted China to provide Pakistan with crucial military and satellite support. This assistance, revealed by an Indian defence research group, included reorganizing Pakistan's radar and air defense systems and adjusting satellite coverage over India.

title: Watch: Army shows how India’s air defence foiled Pak bid to strike Golden Temple
content: Following heightened tensions and Operation Sindoor, Pakistan launched missile and drone attacks targeting Indian cities. The Indian Army, anticipating the threat, successfully intercepted these attacks, particularly safeguarding the Golden Temple from potential destruction. Modern air defence systems, including the indigenous AKASH missile system, played a crucial role in thwarting Pakistan's nefarious designs.

title: Bengaluru flooded again, residents blame official apathy, dread monsoon arrival
content: Residents of Sai Layout in Bengaluru's Horamavu are grappling with severe waterlogging and flooding, even before the monsoon season. Pre-monsoon rains submerged the area, leaving homes flooded and residents without access to clean water. The BBMP is working on temporary solutions like pumping water while a long-term project to restore the stormwater drain's width is underway with railway authorities.

title: Supreme Court orders 'one rank one pension' principle for all HC judges
content: The Supreme Court mandated the One Rank One Pension (OROP) principle for all retired high court judges, eliminating pension disparities based on recruitment source. All retired judges are entitled to a minimum annual pension of Rs 13.65 lakh, with Rs 15 lakh for retired Chief Justices.

title: Watch: Farmer's video of scooping peanuts in heavy rain goes viral
content: A distressing video surfaced showing a farmer in Maharashtra desperately trying to salvage his peanut crop from unseasonal rains. Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, after seeing the video, assured the farmer of compensation and spoke with state officials to expedite aid. Many farmers were left exposed at the mandi, resulting in significant harvest damage.

title: Indian diplomats in Portugal respond to Pak protesters with posters
content: Indian diplomats in Portugal responded to a protest by Pakistani nationals near the Indian Chancery with a silent yet firm message: "Operation Sindoor is not yet over." The Indian Embassy displayed banners with this message, asserting that India will not be intimidated by such provocations. India's Ambassador Puneet Roy Kundal affirmed the embassy's steadfast approach, while also thanking the Portuguese government and police for ensuring the embassy's safety.

title: Operation Sindoor: 'My parents were in PoK,' says star England cricketer
content: England all-rounder Moeen Ali revealed his parents were near the area of India's Operation Sindoor in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK). He recounted the experience of the IPL being halted amidst escalating tensions, creating uncertainty and concern among players about potential war and travel disruptions. Moeen highlighted the difficulty of discerning truth from news outlets during the crisis.

title: Revenge attack: Delhi teen killed after dispute over booking DJ
content: In Delhi, a disagreement regarding DJ services turned deadly. Bheem Sen, an 18-year-old, was fatally stabbed in Mahendra Park. The incident occurred after an argument with a juvenile about a DJ booking. Police arrested four individuals, all believed to be juveniles. They are being processed as Children in Conflict with Law. The investigation is ongoing to recover the weapon.

title: 'Having a Pakistani background...': Ex-England cricketer recalls Ind-Pak conflict
content: Moeen Ali, playing for KKR in the IPL, recounted the unsettling experience of being in India when tensions escalated between India and Pakistan, leading to the IPL's suspension. He lauded KKR's support during the crisis, emphasizing the shared cultural similarities across the border.

title: Shreyas Iyer creates IPL history – no captain has ever done this before
content: Punjab Kings secured a playoff berth by defeating Rajasthan Royals. Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh scored half-centuries. Harpreet Brar took three wickets. Shreyas Iyer became the first captain to lead three different teams into the IPL playoffs. Punjab posted 219 for 5. Rajasthan Royals managed 209 for 7 in reply.

title: 5 dead, 2 injured as car falls onto dry riverbed in Maharashtra
content: A speeding car carrying seven passengers plunged into the Jagbudi River. The vehicle hit a divider before the crash. Five people died, including three women and two men. The deceased were identified. Two injured passengers are receiving treatment. Khed police are investigating the incident. The car was traveling from Nallasopara to Devrukh.

title: Ben Stokes says no to alcohol to stay fit for Test series vs India
content: England test skipper Ben Stokes has been out of action for around five months, ever since he tore his hamstring in the series against New Zealand. With recovering in time for the Zimbabwe series at the top of priorities, the all-rounder has chosen to give up alcohol to get back to his very best.

title: Who is Shehzad Wahab? UP trader-turned Pak spy under guise of crossborder trade
content: In a significant operation, the Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) apprehended Shehzad Wahab, a Rampur-based trader, for allegedly spying for Pakistan under the guise of cross-border smuggling. Wahab, who frequently visited Pakistan, is accused of sharing sensitive information with the ISI, facilitating financial transactions, and recruiting individuals for espionage.

title: Hazaribag labourer builds temple after son bags railway job
content: Jagdish Saw, a labourer from Hazaribag, fulfilled his vow by building a temple after his son secured a government job with the Indian Railways. The pranpratistha ceremony was recently held, and villagers are preparing for a grand yagna. Saw's devotion and the community's collective effort in constructing the temple over 14 months have been widely praised.

title: SC agrees to hear Ashoka Univ prof's PIL against arrest for remarks on Op Sindoor
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a petition from Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad, arrested by Haryana Police for his remarks on Operation Sindoor. CJI B R Gavai's bench will hear the matter on May 20 or 21. Mahmudabad's arrest, following a BJP Yuva Morcha leader's complaint, has sparked concern over free expression within the academic community.

title: 'TMC MP Yusuf Pathan opts out of all-party delegation on Op Sindoor'
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, a senior Trinamool Congress leader emphasized that foreign policy is the Union government's exclusive domain. While pledging support to protect the nation, the leader's statement came as India prepares to dispatch all-party delegations to key partner countries to reinforce its stance against terrorism.

title: B'desh port curbs may shift Rs 1,000 crore textile trade to Indian manufacturers
content: India's restriction on garment imports from Bangladesh via land routes is poised to create a substantial opportunity for the domestic textile sector, potentially worth Rs 1,000-2,000 crore. While boosting local manufacturing and curbing indirect entry of Chinese fabric, this move may disrupt supply chains for apparel brands, leading to a slight price increase for consumers during the winter season.

title: Buy or sell? Gold rate outlook for this week
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices experienced volatility due to US-China trade deal developments, a stronger dollar, and fluctuating investor sentiment. Moody's downgraded the U.S. credit rating, adding to market uncertainty.

title: Hyderabad building fire: Woman found holding four children in final embrace
content: First responders in Hyderabad were deeply affected by the tragic scene of an elderly woman found dead, embracing four children in a fire-ravaged home. Despite attempts to rescue the Modi household residents, seven bodies were recovered, including the woman and children found huddled together. The rescuers described the unbearable sight of the victims, highlighting the devastating impact of the fire.

title: 'Shared info with ISI': UP ATS arrests man for spying for Pak, crossborder smuggling
content: The Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) arrested Shehzad Wahab from Rampur, a suspected Pakistani spy involved in cross-border smuggling from Moradabad. He allegedly maintained direct contact with Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) operatives, providing sensitive information related to India's internal security and facilitating financial transactions. Shehzad is also suspected of recruiting individuals for ISI and supplying Indian SIM cards to agents.

title: KKR’s IPL 2025 slump: 'Thrill factor missing' without Gautam Gambhir?
content: Kolkata Knight Riders, KKR, failed to qualify for the IPL 2025 playoffs. This happened after their 2024 title win. Gautam Gambhir's absence as mentor and Shreyas Iyer not being part of the squad impacted the team. Former KKR opener Manvinder Bisla highlighted Gambhir's influence. He emphasized Gambhir's ability to identify and support match-winning players. Ajinkya Rahane captained KKR in 2025.

title: Watch: Army drops new video of Op Sindoor showing drone takedown, precision strikes
content: Following a deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, the Indian Army launched Operation Sindoor on May 7, targeting nine terror-linked sites in Pakistan and PoK. The operation involved precision airstrikes and vigilance against Pakistani drones. In response to Pakistan's shelling and drone attempts, India broadened its strikes to include 11 airbases.

title: Here's why Aishwarya Rai Bachchan brings Aaradhya every year to Cannes
content: In 2023, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan brought her daughter Aaradhya to Cannes, a festival she first visited with her mother. Aaradhya feels at home there, enjoys reconnecting with friends, and is developing a deep appreciation for cinema, accompanying Aishwarya to events like the 'Ponniyin Selvan: II' premiere.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.2 jolts Afghanistan
content: Afghanistan has been struck by a series of earthquakes over the past four days, with the latest being a 4.2 magnitude tremor. The earthquake occurred at a depth of 140 kms. The country is prone to seismic activity due to its location on several fault lines. These frequent disasters exacerbate the challenges faced by vulnerable communities already struggling with conflict and under-development.

title: Watch: Kuldeep Yadav loses cool, confronts umpire during DC vs GT match
content: Kuldeep Yadav's frustration boiled over after an umpire's call denied him an early wicket against Gujarat Titans. Sai Sudharsan, the beneficiary of the call, went on to score a century, leading the Titans to a dominant 10-wicket victory over Delhi Capitals.

title: Ashoka University professor held for ‘endangering unity’ over post on Op Sindoor
content: Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad was arrested following complaints about his comments on 'Operation Sindoor'. Haryana State Women’s Commission chairperson Renu Bhatia and BJP Yuva Morcha's Yogesh Jatheri filed separate FIRs, alleging threats to national integrity and promoting enmity. The faculty association has condemned the arrest as harassment, citing Mahmudabad's commitment to communal harmony.

title: Biden diagnosed with 'aggressive' prostate cancer
content: Former President Joe Biden, 82, has been diagnosed with prostate cancer after a routine physical exam revealed a nodule. Doctors confirmed the cancer has spread to his bones but is hormone-sensitive, allowing for effective management. Biden and his family are reviewing treatment options, adding to his medical history that includes past skin cancer treatments and public scrutiny over his health.

title: Cops foil terror bid; 2 held for plotting blasts, testing explosives
content: Telangana and Andhra Pradesh police arrested two individuals, Sameer from Hyderabad and Siraj Ur Rehman from Vizianagaram. They were allegedly planning bomb blasts. Siraj procured bomb-making materials online. The duo intended to test explosives near Vizianagaram. Intelligence officials intervened after learning of the conspiracy. Interrogation revealed plans for a terrorist strike.

title: Deadly Boko Haram attack kills 57, leaves 70 missing in Nigeria's villages
content: In Borno, Nigeria, a devastating attack by Boko Haram's JAS faction resulted in at least 57 deaths and over 70 missing from two villages, with victims accused of being informants for ISWAP.

title: Nifty50 near 25,000; BSE Sensex opens over 100 points down
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was near 25,000, BSE Sensex was above 82,200.

title: Israel recovers spy Eli Cohen's archive from Syria 60 years after he was hanged
content: Israel has recovered the official Syrian archive of spy Eli Cohen, executed in 1965, in a covert Mossad operation. The archive, containing 2,500 documents, photos, and personal items, was presented to Cohen's widow. Recovered materials include handwritten letters, forged passports, and the original death sentence, offering insights into Cohen's intelligence work and final days.
